TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataGridPagerStyle extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle
Public NotInheritable Class DataGridPagerStyle Inherits TableItemStyle

Docs.summary: Specifies the style for the pager of the control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The pager is an element on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control that allows you to link to other pages when paging is enabled. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.PagerStyle%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control uses an instance of this class to represent the style properties for the pager.
For more information on paging, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowPaging%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowCustomPaging%2A>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle> object to represent the style of the pager element in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.PagerStyle%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle> object sets the display mode and alignment of the paging element.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataGridPagerStyle Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataGridPagerStyle Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void MergeWith(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub MergeWith (s As Style)

Docs.summary: Merges the style of the specified object with this instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with this instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle> class. If a property from this instance is already set to a value, the property is unchanged. If a property is not set, this method sets that property with the value from the corresponding property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the properties of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle> object.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.MergeWith Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.MergeWith Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.MergeWith Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.MergeWith Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::WebControls::PagerMode Mode { System::Web::UI::WebControls::PagerMode get(); void set(System::Web::UI::WebControls::PagerMode value); };
member this.Mode : System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerMode with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the pager element displays buttons that link to the next and previous page, or numeric buttons that link directly to a page.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Mode%2A> property to specify which set of pager buttons to use on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. You can specify buttons that link to the next and previous page, or numeric buttons that link directly to a page.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Mode%2A> property to specify that the pager element is displayed as buttons that link to the next and previous page.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.Mode Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.Mode Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.Mode Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.Mode Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception: The specified value is not one of the values.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NextPageText { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.NextPageText : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed for the next page button.
Docs.value: The text to display for the next page button. The default value is , which is rendered as the greater than sign (>).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText%2A> property to provide custom text for the next page button. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Mode%2A> property must be set to `PagerMode.NextPrev` for this property to have any effect.
This property is used along with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.PrevPageText%2A> property to create a custom set of controls for the next and previous buttons of the pager on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property does not automatically encode special characters to HTML. You need to convert these characters to the appropriate HTML value. For example the greater than sign (>) will not automatically convert to `>`.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool. For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText%2A> property to specify custom text for the next page navigation button of the pager element.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception: The specified value is less than .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int PageButtonCount { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.PageButtonCount : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of numeric buttons to display concurrently in the pager element of the control.
Docs.value: The number of numeric buttons to display concurrently in the pager element of the control. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.PageButtonCount%2A> property to specify the number of numeric buttons to display concurrently in the pager element of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Mode%2A> property must be set to `PagerMode.NumericPages` for this property to have any effect.
If there are more pages in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control than specified in this property, ellipsis buttons (...) are displayed in the pager element. When clicked, these buttons display the next or previous set of numeric buttons.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.PageButtonCount%2A> property to display five numeric page buttons concurrently in the pager element of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.PageButtonCount Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.PageButtonCount Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.PageButtonCount Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.PageButtonCount Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception: The selected value is less than .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::WebControls::PagerPosition Position { System::Web::UI::WebControls::PagerPosition get(); void set(System::Web::UI::WebControls::PagerPosition value); };
member this.Position : System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the position of the pager element in the control.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Position%2A> property to specify the location where the pager element is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. The pager element can be displayed at the upper edge, the lower edge, or at both the upper and lower edges of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Position%2A> property to specify that the pager is displayed at the upper edge of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.Position Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.Position Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.Position Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.Position Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception: The specified value is not one of the values.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PrevPageText { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.PrevPageText : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed for the previous page button.
Docs.value: The text to display for the previous page button. The default value is , which is rendered as the less than sign (<).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.PrevPageText%2A> property to provide custom text for the next page button. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Mode%2A> property must be set to `PagerMode.NextPrev` for this property to have any effect.
This property is used along with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText%2A> property to create a custom appearance for the next and previous buttons of the pager on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property does not automatically encode special characters to HTML. You need to convert special characters to the appropriate HTML value. For example, the greater than sign (>) will not automatically convert to `>`.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool. For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.PrevPageText%2A> property to specify custom text for the previous page navigation button of the pager element.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

member this.Visible : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the pager is displayed in the control.
Docs.value: to display the pager; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Visible%2A> property to specify whether the pager is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Visible%2A> property to display and hide the pager element in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
